1.question:
Is this a brand-new site or application/tool?

Terms:
Site: An online page or collection of related pages under a single domain name.

Application: A website or web tool that has a technical component beyond static text. For instance, a site where a user signs in with a password, or inputs information and sees a result, or an interactive map that has functionality that interacts with the user. Generally, an application is a site we create that helps a user accomplish a task.

3.question: <b>Is this a redesign or large overhaul of an existing EERE site?</br>

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: a redesign or large overhaul of an existing EERE site

no.label: No
no.val: No: a redesign or large overhaul of an existing EERE site

4.question: Is this new site or application for an EERE office or area?

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: new site or application for an EERE office or area

no.label: No
no.val: No: new site or application for an EERE office or area

5.question:
Is this an update to the existing site, such as a few new pages
or edits to existing pages?

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: update to the existing site, such as a few new pages or edits to existing pages

no.label: No
no.val: No: update to the existing site, such as a few new pages or edits to existing pages

6.question:
Is this a lab project funded by EERE?

Terms:
Lab project: An online site or tool supported by a DOE national lab with funding, personnel, and/or content.

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: lab project is funded by EERE

no.label: No
no.val: No: lab project is funded by EERE

7.question:
Is this a move of an existing site from one host platform to another?

Terms:
Host platform: The network server or system where a website is hosted.
Examples: The Energy.gov Drupal content management system (CMS), the EERE Centralized Web Hosting Environment (ECWHE), the hosting environments of labs such as NREL or PNNL.

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: a move of an existing site from one host platform to another

no.label: No
no.val: No: a move of an existing site from one host platform to another

8.question:
Is this a partnership project with external stakeholders?

Terms:
Partnership project: A project where DOE collaborates with an outside organization(s), such as other government agencies, nonprofit groups, local groups, businesses, etc. Often, the logos of the other partners will appear on the website, and the partner may provide funding to the effort.

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: a partnership project with external stakeholders

no.label: No
no.val: No: a partnership project with external stakeholders

9.question:
Is this a request for a special/marketing URL or redirect for an existing site?

Terms:
Marketing URL: A web address used in marketing materials.
Example: buildings.energy.gov, as printed in a BTO fact sheet

Redirect: A URL or web address that is set up to take the user from one web page to another. Often a redirect is set up if a page or site has been deleted, so that the user will be directed to the new site. Sometimes a redirect is set up for a marketing URL. For instance, the buildings.energy.gov marketing URL used in outreach materials is a redirect that takes the user to https://www.energy.gov/eere/buildings/building-technologies-office.

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: a request for a special / marketing URL or redirect for an existing site

no.label: No
no.val: No: a request for a special / marketing URL or redirect for an existing site

10.question:
Does this partnership project have EERE funding?

More info

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: a partnership project with EERE funding

no.label: No
no.val: No: a partnership project with EERE funding

11.question:
Is this a request to change the navigation of an existing site?

Terms:
Navigation: The sections or structure of a site, as indicated by the clickable labels that lead to them,
such as “About or “Contact”.

More info

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: a request to change the navigation of an existing site

no.label: No
no.val: No: a request to change the navigation of an existing site

12.question: Will the site or tool be located in the DOE web environment?

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: site or tool located in the DOE web environment

no.label: No
no.val: No: site or tool located in the DOE web environment

13.question:
Is this a usability project?

14.question:
Does this new URL begin with "Energy.gov/eere/[tech_office]"?

More info

15.question:
Is this a request for a new nested group in the Energy.gov CMS,
or any other request not mentioned?

Terms:
Nested group: A section in the Drupal content management system that denotes a separate area of the DOE family of sites.
Examples: EERE has a separate nested group in the Energy.gov CMS, as indicated by the /eere/ in the site’s URLs, and each of the tech offices has its own nested group, denoted by the /eere/xxx/ in the site URLs.

yes.label: Yes
yes.val: Yes: a request for a new nested group in the Energy.gov CMS, or any other request not mentioned

no.label: No
no.val: No: a request for a new nested group in the Energy.gov CMS, or any other request not mentioned

23.question:
Yes, your project requires WGT review.

Contact Billie Bates to schedule a WGT Meeting (10 a.m. Eastern / 8 a.m. Mountain on Thursdays)

You'll find additional guidance in our FAQs and on our EERE Communication Standards site.
You can also contact Allison Hartfiel for questions on your project charter or details.

Here's an example of a similar project that went through WGT review: Funding Site Redesign

EERE Web Governance Team

Christina Stowers, EERE web enterprise manager
Allison Hartfiel, web template coordinator / communications liason
Karl Chan, tech lead / admin for ECWHE
Billie Bates, WGT project manager / facilitator
Shaida Beklik, cyber security rep
Rowena Clemente, cyber security rep
Brian Szabelski, EERE Communications Standards site editor
Alex Clayborne, technical manager / AFS program manager
David Crouch, ad hoc member for budget
